intro: Moronobea coccinea, commonly known as the red moronobea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom during the warmer months. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are showy and attract various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
